titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the James B. Donovan papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Ronald M. Bulatoff, revised by Rebecca Mead

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-27T10:14-0800

change.item: November 27, 2017: Added links for items on digitalcollections.hoover.org to the "Declassified U.S. Government Records" series. April 19, 2017: Revised to open box 34 after preservation cleaning. October 28, 2016: Revised to open boxes 6, 14, 19, 24, 43, after preservation cleaning. April 20, 2016: Revised to open box 40 after preservation review. February 24, 2016: Revised to open most photograph envelopes after review by preservation staff. January 5, 2016: Revised to close most boxes after preservation survey of materials. Previously closed boxes 89-90 (use copies in 39-40) included in closed material in need of preservation work. October 29, 2014: Revised to add photograph card file data. July 30, 2012: Revised to update encoding. October 2010: Declassified records series added by Lisa Miller. January 15, 2010: Corrected error discovered by researcher in box labels. Updated code for OAC standards, combined series desc and container list to one dsc. March 23, 2004: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::James B. Donovan Papers)//EN" "reg_266.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, memoranda, studies, drafts of book manuscripts, scrapbooks, notes, photographs, and printed matter relating to the United States Office of Scientific Research and Development and the Office of Strategic Services during World War II, the Nuremberg war crime trials, the Rudolf Abel-Gary Powers spy exchange, the Cuban prisoner exchange following the Bay of Pigs landing, and the New York City Board of Education. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

originalsloc.head: Location of Original Materials
originalsloc.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 2, 6, 14, 19, 24, 34, 38-40, 43, 65-66, 68, 75-76, 78-80, 85-88, 92-93 and envelopes A, C-I are available for use. The remainder of the collection is closed for preservation purposes. Please contact the Hoover Institution Archives for more information.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.
Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], James B. Donovan papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1972.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, memoranda, studies, drafts of book manuscripts, scrapbooks, notes, photographs, and printed matter relating to the United States Office of Scientific Research and Development and the Office of Strategic Services during World War II, the Nuremberg war crime trials, the Rudolf Abel-Gary Powers spy exchange, the Cuban prisoner exchange following the Bay of Pigs landing, and the New York City Board of Education.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Office of Scientific Research and Development.
United States. Office of Strategic Services.
controlaccess.subject: Education--New York (N.Y.)
Espionage.
Nuremberg Trial of Major German War Criminals, Nuremberg, Germany, 1945-1946.
War crime trials.
World War, 1939-1945--Secret service.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Material relating to naval service, early law career, participation in professional and charitable organizations, financial material, family history, clippings, appointments books and correspondence, arranged by subject.

did.unittitle: General. Award certificate, clippings, class reunion materials,
Family history materials. Clippings and pamphlets,
Financial materials. Correspondence and other materials related to investments
General. Clippings, letters and miscellany, Includes a letter from Felix Frankfurter
Insurance, Negligence and Compensation Law Section. Correspondence, minutes, memoranda, reports,
International Law Section, Special Committee on Diplomatic Immunity. Correspondence, reports and printed material,

Guild of Catholic Lawyers of the City of New York. Printed material, notes, legal documents, letters, and a speech transcript relating to a decision by the New York City school administration to omit The Nation from their subscription list,
New York Daily News. Legal documents relating to multiple cases,
Naval service. Personnel materials, letters, memoranda, and pamphlets,
Non-printed material. Chronological file, primarily correspondence,
Printed material. Pamphlets, newsletters, and miscellany,
General. Press releases, yearbook, clippings, pamphlets, correspondence, memoranda, budgets and financial reports, and minutes,
Senatorial campaign, 1962. Also includes material relating to earlier Democratic Party activities,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts, proofs, and printed copies of speeches and writings with related correspondence, clippings, books reviews, and miscellany, arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: General. Miscellaneous editorials, book reviews, citations, speeches, clippings, correspondence, draft and printed articles,
Challenges, 1967. Correspondence, printed material and two printed copies of the book,
"The Defense of Colonel Abel," Teleplay typescript

Kahn's attempt at decoding Hayhanen's and Abel's messages
General. Untitled typescripts relating to Abel trial,
Earlier draft, with annotations and corrections

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, briefs, court statements, background studies, lists, reports, notes, affidavits, search warrants, trial notes, trial transcripts and exhibits, and diary relating to the Abel Spy Case and the exchange of Rudolf Abel for Gary Powers. Includes letter of congratulations from President Kennedy and correspondence with Abel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Record of proceedings of Eichman trial, legal plans, background materials, procedure outlines, correspondence and articles about J. B. Donovan's service as assistant to U.S. Chief Prosecutor in Nuremberg, Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports, memoranda, and manuals relating to legal problems handled by J. B. Donovan as general counsel, e.g. organizational legal questions, capturing prisoners, wills and insurance, problems of agents in general, authority to make certain weapons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, Cuban trial records, lists of prisoners, requests for release, Cuban exile material, background reports, press releases, diary, secret memoranda, notes on meetings, and other material relating to the negotiation of the Cuban prisoner exchange.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, correspondence, telegrams, and legal documents relating to the defection of Major Richard H. Pearce to Cuba. See also: OVERSIZE FILE for additional clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, policy reports and studies, agenda and minutes of meetings, clippings, and other material relating to the operation of schools in New York during J. B. Donovan's term as president, arranged by subject.

did.unittitle: General. Letters, memoranda, reports, charts, flyers, pamphlets, newsletters and printed articles primarily relating to the organization of the Board of Education,
General. Letters relating to speaking engagements, congratulations, and other letters, most of which relate personally to James Donovan rather than official Board of Education matters

Educational parks. Letters, memoranda, pamphlet and maps,
Ethics, Special Committee on. Hearing transcript,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbooks, clippings, serial issue, card files, and book illustration drawings and plates.

did.unittitle: Chart and two scrapbooks relating to the Nuremberg trials; one scrapbook relating to the Office of Strategic Services
Two scrapbooks of clippings and other material relating to the Abel case
Three scrapbooks of clippings and other material relating to the Abel case
One scrapbook of clippings relating to the Mr. Donovan's Senatorial campaign
One scrapbook relating to Cuban prisoners; clippings relating to the defection of Major Richard Pearce to Cuba; card files relating to Cuban prisoners

Two scrapbooks relating to Cuban prisoners; 14 drawings, some of which appear to have been used as illustrations in Strangers on a Bridge, as well as cover design illustration materials; issue of Esquire magazine, relating to spying and the U-2 incident; and miscellaneous clippings
Two scrapbooks relating to the New York City Board of Education
25 prints depicting exhibit materials used in the US vs. Abel trials,
3 prints of James B. Donovan and other officials at the International Military Tribunal, Nuremberg, war crimes trials,
18 prints of J. B. Donovan, Fidel Castro, and other individuals in Cuba,
9 prints of J. B. Donovan during various stages of his life with associates and family members,
17 prints of J. B. Donovan on a walking tour of Manhattan College and advance taping of "Race for the Senate," WNEW-TV, New York,
6 prints of J. B. Donovan and other during the taping of "Newmakers," WCBS-TV, New York,
2 prints of J. B. Donovan with President Kennedy, Senator Jacob Javits, and John Tillman,
55 prints of J. B. Donovan on a walking tour in Brooklyn, the Bronx, Manhattan, and Staten Island,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Available as PDF files. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder by date of creation.
